Paul. Jinnō Shōtōki, pp. 148-150. ==Events of the Ten'ō era== * 22 December 781 (Ten'ō 1, 3rd day of the 12th month): In 11th year of the reign of Emperor Kōnin's reign (光仁天皇11年), he abdicated. The succession (senso) was received by his son.Titsingh, pp. 85; Brown, p. 277. Soon after, Emperor Kammu is said to have accepted the monarch's role and duties and powers (sokui).Titsingh, p. 86 This was confirmed in ceremonies.Varley, p. 44; a distinct act of senso is unrecognized prior to Emperor Tenji; and all sovereigns except Jitō, Yōzei, Go-Toba, and Fushimi have senso and sokui in the same year until the reign of Emperor Go-Murakami.
